New Records: Travis Head took a career-best of 4 for 28
Australia used 23 consecutive overs of spin and 28 off the last 29 in total, a record for Australia in a men's ODI
Key Match Events: Ben Duckett struck his second ODI hundred but England collapsed in Bristol and couldn't contain the visitors' top order
Matthew Short got Australia's innings off to a flying start
Travis Head and Short cut loose as 62 came off the next four overs
Brydon Carse struck first ball to remove Head
Short edged behind after a 23-ball maiden ODI fifty
Steven Smith, who successfully reviewed being given lbw to Matthew Potts on 10, and Josh Inglis ensured against further setbacks
Pre-Game Insights: Speaking on TV before the game, Ricky Ponting said Australia would rate a series win very highly given the challenges within the squad
Post-Match Reflections: At the end of a tour marked by illness and injury they had again been forced to shuffle their pack after Marsh pulled up sore after Lord's where he bowled for the first time since early April
Miscellaneous Highlights: The rain, which had initially arrived during the interval, then returned four balls after a result had been assured with a DLS of 116 for 2
Others: Andrew McGlashan is a deputy editor at ESPNcricinfo
